quoted_tweet.text:
NEW: Bill Maher says Democrats didn‚Äôt just flirt with woke‚Äîthey married it, and now it‚Äôs dragging the whole party off a cliff.

Maher just dropped a brutal reality check: if Democrats don‚Äôt cut ties with the woke cult, they‚Äôre finished.

‚ÄúYou get a certain amount of cult followers for anything and then the true believers never die.‚Äù

And if the party doesn‚Äôt break free?

‚ÄúA lot of people would say right now the Democratic Party is still in that mode, which is going to render them, possibly, an irrelevant party if they don't change.‚Äù

His solution?

‚ÄúMuch more centrism‚Äîget rid of the woke baggage, you know? Old school liberal is what I usually describe myself as,‚Äù he said.

But don‚Äôt confuse that with today‚Äôs woke ideology.

‚ÄúWoke would like people to believe that they're some sort of an extension of liberalism, but they're not.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey're usually something that's quite opposite.‚Äù

Then Maher dropped the hammer:

‚ÄúLiberalism was, we should have a colorblind society and not see race at all. That‚Äôs not what the woke believe. They‚Äôre the opposite. Put race at the front of everything.‚Äù

Bill is the canary in the coal mine: if Democrats don‚Äôt drop the dead weight, they won‚Äôt just lose power‚Äîthey‚Äôll cease to exist.

tweets.text: @AutismCapital I was thinking of posting video logs

Important to note that what matters is the ability to refine rare earth elements (which are NOT actually meaningfully rare) and manufacture magnets for use in electric motors. 

People understandably tend to think that rare earth mineral deposits are what‚Äôs scarce, given the name. That is false. They‚Äôre everywhere.

As with lithium, what China has that others lack is the heavy industry of refining the minerals.
